q: How do you pass a variable into a module?
choices: Inside the module block using variable_name = value
By editing variables.tf inside the module
By exporting it as an environment variable
By modifying the .terraform directory
explain: Module inputs are passed as arguments inside the module block in the root configuration.

q: How can outputs from a child module be accessed in the root module? (Select all that apply)
choices: Using module.<MODULE_NAME>.<OUTPUT_NAME>
By copying them manually into root variables
By referencing them directly in resource blocks
By using terraform output after apply
explain: Outputs can be referenced with module.<MODULE_NAME>.<OUTPUT_NAME> and also shown via `terraform output`.

q: How do you pass a variable into a module? (variant 3)
choices: Inside the module block using variable_name = value
By editing variables.tf inside the module
By exporting it as an environment variable
By modifying the .terraform directory
explain: Module inputs are passed as arguments inside the module block in the root configuration.
